title: Welcome to the ACM Web Science 2011
segmentation: It's fantastic to be here at the third websites conference.
I don't think any of us when we started this thing thought about the fact that we would end up.
Arranging a complex series.
We just knew there was research to be done and that it was something that hadn't.
It was typing research that hadn't been done before and that it couldn't be called computer science or social science, or it had to be something new and for good or bad.
Record it websites and now we have the beginnings of a community of web scientists and there was several workshops this morning.
I'm really pleased to see the health people here.
Hello, Health people, are you there or you?

I don't think in my wildest imaginations when we first started talking about this back in 2005, 2006 dreams that in such a short space of time there would be so many really good quality work science courses out there around the world.

Turn the websites research initiative into a not for profit charity, which we called the Websites Trust, which is independent of any individual University and seeks to raise awareness of websites around the world, both research education.

But the important thing is that there is now an organization that can pass the baton of this conference forward.
This steering group we will meet tomorrow lunchtime as you do to decide about future conferences and I hope to see this conference grow and mature as we move forward.
So I'm now going to hand over three months.
And who is the Chair of Sick Web until the end of June?
